name: Commodore 64 Tape Image File
summary: Learn about .T64 files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Commodore 64 supported various storage devices for transporting and loading data. Examples of supported devices include floppy disks, cartridges, and datasettes (data cassettes that were magnetic tape data storage devices).

Miha Peternel developed the T64 format to store game or program data copied from a Commodore tape storage device. The T64 format is one of several formats utilized to store Commodore 64 games or programs that computer enthusiasts load in emulators to run the game or program. Other formats created by Commodore 64 enthusiasts include .G41, .D64, and .X64.

instructions: You can open T64 files with several emulators, including Vice (multiplatform), WinVICE (Windows), and CCS64 (Windows). You can also upload T64 files to C64 online emulator to run them in a web browser or run T64 files with Joerg Jahnke Mobile C64 on an Android device.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
